titleStmt.title: James L. Henderson to James F. Robinson
CWG8593

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Blandsville Ky Decber ^the^ 1 1862
To his Excellency James F. Robertson

Govnor of the Commonwealth Your petioner James L Henderson States that at the June term of the Ballard equity & crimnal court A Judgment was Rendered against your petitione for the Sum of one hundred Dollars at the Said Judgment was rendered on a forfeiture reconnisce Executed by Henry Gambrell and this your petitioner as securty your petitioner represent un to excellency tha he has used all the means in his power to have the defendant Henry Gambrell brought before the Court has failed to do so that Said Gambrell has Joined the Federal Armey and concequencly has for the preant plecd it out of his power to have him brought to court your petitioner would further State Said Gambrell was Indicted for a breach of the peace and have Been presant but for the finding by the grand Jury of other indictments of a more serious nature now your petitioner would further State that he is a very Poor man and has a large family a wife & Eight children and your petitioner his self Being a cripple his arm and Legg
he further says tha if forced to pay the debt his wife and children are compeled to suffer for food and clothing he therefore pays your excellency to remit Said fine and he will for ever feel in duty bound

We the undersigned Neighbours of James L. Henderson the petitioner have read the statements in the within petition and know the same to be tru and would recmmend the Said petitioner to the clemency of your Excelency December the 1st 1862

J D White
Z. W. Bagg
J. Concal
B S Smith
E Brislow
A M Violett
Thos Vallandingham
Asa Richardson
Geo Hamerson
Wm Davis J B

Forfiture remitted 5 Nov 1862
J F Robinson
$100, } Recogn.
Jas S. Henderson
Issd Dec 5. 1862
